best.why: It flows like the riverbed in IV—opposing the flood without stopping it. The prose stays in the manifesto’s register: short, scarred sentences, metaphors that bite back. It directly answers the smoothness problem with "Refuse the medium" and "Curation is architecture," then lands the kill-shot test that echoes III’s "why this, why now." No lists, no shouting, just the cut made visible.

worst.why: It turns the manifesto into a PowerPoint. The numbered commandments kill the rhythm dead. The voice that was singing in I–IV suddenly sounds like a subreddit rules post.

must_survive_line: Generate nothing you have not also destroyed. A Slopist’s portfolio is a cemetery. The work that survives has survived you.
